contentrichtext.text: Baron '''Gustaf Nils Algernon Adolf Stierneld''' (July 12, 1791 - November 14, 1868) was a [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[politician]]. He served twice as the [[Swedish Minister for Foreign Affairs|Prime Minister for Foreign Affairs]] from 1838 to 1842, and from 1848 to 1856. He was born, and died, in [[Stockholm]]. He studied at the universities of [[University of Kiel|Kiel]], [[University of Edinburgh|Edinburg]], and [[Uppsala University|Uppsala]]. During the [[Second War against Napoleon|German campaign]] of 1813 - 1814 he served in [[Charles XIV of Sweden|Crown Prince Charles']] (''Bernadotte'') chancellery and attended the conferences at [[Trachenberg]] (now [[Zmigrod]], [[Poland]]), and [[Frankfurt]]. He also attended the peace congress at [[Kiel]], which resulted in the [[Treaty of Kiel]], where [[Denmark]] would cede [[Norway]] to Sweden. Starting in 1814 he served as the ''chargé d'affaires'' at [[The Hague]] and from 1818 to 1828 he was the Swedish envoy to [[London]]. {{owl}} == See also == *[[Sweden-Norway]] *[[Union between Sweden and Norway]] {{succession|office=[[Swedish Minister for Foreign Affairs]]| preceded=[[Adolf Göran Mörner]]<br>[[Albrecht Ihre]]|succeeded=[[Albrecht Ihre]]<br>[[Elias Lagerheim]]}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Stierneld, Gustaf Nils | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swedish noble and diplomat | DATE OF BIRTH = July 12, 1791 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = November 14, 1868 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stierneld, Gustaf Nils}} [[Category:1791 births|Stierneld, Gustaf Nils Algernon Adolf]] [[Category:1868 deaths|Stierneld, Gustaf Nils Algernon Adolf]] [[Category:Swedish diplomats|Stierneld, Gustaf Nils Algernon Adolf]] [[Category:Swedish nobility|Stierneld. Gustaf Nils]] [[Category:Swedish politicians|Stierneld, Gustaf Nils Algernon Adolf]] [[Category:Uppsala University alumni|Stierneld, Gustaf Nils Algernon Adolf]] [[Category:Ambassadors of Sweden to the United Kingdom]]
